intro: Leandra furfurella, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
